trans-unit.source: Service Bus Relayed Messaging
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Relayed Messaging

trans-unit.source: Overview of Service Bus relay.
trans-unit.target: Overview of Service Bus relay.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus relayed messaging
trans-unit.target: Service Bus relayed messaging

trans-unit.source: The central component of Service Bus is a centralized (but highly load-balanced) relay service that enables you to build hybrid applications that run in both an Azure datacenter and your own on-premises enterprise environment.
trans-unit.target: The central component of Service Bus is a centralized (but highly load-balanced) relay service that enables you to build hybrid applications that run in both an Azure datacenter and your own on-premises enterprise environment.

trans-unit.source: The relay service supports a variety of different transport protocols and web services standards.
trans-unit.target: The relay service supports a variety of different transport protocols and web services standards.

trans-unit.source: This includes SOAP, WS-*, and even REST.
trans-unit.target: This includes SOAP, WS-*, and even REST.

trans-unit.source: The Service Bus relay facilitates your hybrid applications by enabling you to securely expose Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) services that reside within a corporate enterprise network to the public cloud, without having to open a firewall connection, or require intrusive changes to a corporate network infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: The Service Bus relay facilitates your hybrid applications by enabling you to securely expose Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) services that reside within a corporate enterprise network to the public cloud, without having to open a firewall connection, or require intrusive changes to a corporate network infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Relay Concepts
trans-unit.target: Relay Concepts

trans-unit.source: The relay service supports traditional one-way messaging, request/response messaging, and peer-to-peer messaging.
trans-unit.target: The relay service supports traditional one-way messaging, request/response messaging, and peer-to-peer messaging.

trans-unit.source: It also supports event distribution at internet-scope to enable publish/subscribe scenarios and bi-directional socket communication for increased point-to-point efficiency.
trans-unit.target: It also supports event distribution at internet-scope to enable publish/subscribe scenarios and bi-directional socket communication for increased point-to-point efficiency.

trans-unit.source: In the relayed messaging pattern, an on-premises service connects to the relay service through an outbound port and creates a bi-directional socket for communication tied to a particular rendezvous address.
trans-unit.target: In the relayed messaging pattern, an on-premises service connects to the relay service through an outbound port and creates a bi-directional socket for communication tied to a particular rendezvous address.

trans-unit.source: The client can then communicate with the on-premises service by sending messages to the relay service targeting the rendezvous address.
trans-unit.target: The client can then communicate with the on-premises service by sending messages to the relay service targeting the rendezvous address.

trans-unit.source: The relay service will then "relay" messages to the on-premises service through the bi-directional socket already in place.
trans-unit.target: The relay service will then "relay" messages to the on-premises service through the bi-directional socket already in place.

trans-unit.source: The client does not need a direct connection to the on-premises service, it is not required to know where the service resides, and the on-premises service does not need any inbound ports open on the firewall.
trans-unit.target: The client does not need a direct connection to the on-premises service, it is not required to know where the service resides, and the on-premises service does not need any inbound ports open on the firewall.

trans-unit.source: You initiate the connection between your on-premise service and the relay service using a suite of WCF "relay" bindings.
trans-unit.target: You initiate the connection between your on-premise service and the relay service using a suite of WCF "relay" bindings.

trans-unit.source: Behind the scenes, the relay bindings map to new transport binding elements designed to create WCF channel components that integrate with Service Bus in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Behind the scenes, the relay bindings map to new transport binding elements designed to create WCF channel components that integrate with Service Bus in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: For more information about Service Bus relay, see the following topics.

trans-unit.target: Azure Service Bus Architectural Overview
